    • Method Detail

      • weightSketchesAndClusterToFinalStartPoints

        public static java.util.List<Instances> weightSketchesAndClusterToFinalStartPoints(int numRuns,
                                                                   int numClusters,
                                                                   CentroidSketch[] finalSketches,
                                                                   KMeansReduceTask[] statsForSketches,
                                                                   boolean debug)
                                                                            throws DistributedWekaException
        Utility method to perform the last phase of the k-means|| initialization - i.e. takes the final centroid sketches and the clustering stats that show how many training points are assigned to each instance (candidate center) in each sketch, and then weights the sketch centroids and runs a local KMeans on the weighted data to get the final requested number of starting points.
        Parameters:
        numRuns - number of runs of k-means being done
        numClusters - the requested number of clusters (and thus starting points for k-means)
        finalSketches - the final centroid sketches produced by the first phase of k-means||
        statsForSketches - the clustering statistics for the final sketches
        debug - true if debugging info is to be output
        Returns:
        a final list of starting points (one set of instances for each run of k-means to be performed)
        Throws:
        DistributedWekaException - if a problem occurs

      • getPrimingDataForDistanceFunction

        public static Instances getPrimingDataForDistanceFunction(Instances headerWithSummary)
                                                   throws DistributedWekaException
        Compute priming data for a distance function (i.e. data that can be used to intialize the mins and maxes of numeric variables for normalization purposes).
        Parameters:
        headerWithSummary - header with summary attributes
        Returns:
        a two-instance data set containing min and maxes for all numeric attributes. Nominal attributes will have missing values
        Throws:
        DistributedWekaException - if a problem occurs
